abstract.p: Government names the governor of Bank Indonesia, Syahril Sabirin, as a suspect in the Bank Bali affair; Sabirin is said to have attended meetings during which officials pressed executives at Bank Bali to funnel money into company linked to former ruling party in return for favorable treatment; Sabirin rejects calls from Pres Abdurrahman Wahid for his resignation (S)

block.p: A long-simmering bank scandal in Indonesia has ensnared the country's top central banker. The government named the governor of Bank Indonesia, Syahril Sabirin, as a suspect in the Bank Bali affair. Mr. Sabirin was said to have attended meetings during which officials pressed executives at Bank Bali to funnel money into a company linked to the former ruling party in return for favorable treatment. Mr. Sabirin has denied wrongdoing. Setting up a showdown with Indonesia's president, Abdurrahman Wahid, Mr. Sabirin rejected Mr. Wahid's calls for his resignation.
